titleInfo.title: 225HA3 Hixon Mound Site 1HA3, Hamilton Co., TN. North corner of Feature 68 showing post molds and disorderly mass of charred wood, cane and thatch lying on the floor and inside the limits of the structure. Direction southwest

mods.abstract: Hard, burned clay floor and associated wall trenches and post molds of a rectangular small pole structure. From the quantities of burned clay and framentary charcoal over and around this structure it had apparently burned after or during use. (Sketch on reverse side). Possibly a little more than half of the entire prepared floor area remained. Intrusive burial pits were partially responsible.... I did not suspect the structure extended so far to the west because of the absence of flooring. However, the length of trench on the SE side suggests that its parallel mate was as least as long. Subsequent checking with earlier ground plans shows the possible extent of NW trench to the west by the presence of a few intermittent postmolds. Feature 68 was no doubt an important structure in the village life at a time previous to mound construction.... No postmolds showed in the trench in contact with pit or immediately to the south.
mods.note: Additional narative information and observer illustrations available at the institution. See also photographs 223HA3 [fhm00896], 224HA3 [fhm00897], and 227HA3 [fhm00900].
